alert.note: Alert for Inland Broward County; Inland Palm Beach County; Metro Broward County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 6:28PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Broward and southeastern Palm Beach Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 628 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a funnel cloud near Intersection I-75 And U.S. 27, or 9 miles west of Sunrise, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds, winds in excess of 40 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Coral Springs, Sunrise, Tamarac, Weston, Parkland, Mile Marker 30 On Alligator Alley, Loxahatchee NWR, East Toll Gate On Alligator Alley, Intersection I-75 And U.S. 27 and Ramblewood East. FUNNEL CLOUD...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Move indoors and stay away from windows.

area.areaDesc: Inland Broward County; Inland Palm Beach County; Metro Broward County
